story: Moutaz Shams shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Umbraco - Security vulnerability found - immediate action recommended
caption: umbraco.com
description: During one of our regular security audits of the core, a severe security vulnerability was found in the integration web services of Umbraco and we recommend everyone to take immediate action to prevent any exploit.

data.message: حقير جدا، قارنه بحاجه زي Sitefinity ، فرق السماء والأرض، مثل الفرق بين ويندوز 98 و ويندوز 7، على الأقل من حيث واجهة الاستخدام بالنسبة للمستخدم العادي

If you have a specific problem you can demonstrate in a constructive way, I may be able to connect you to the right people who can either help you directly, or get the core team aware of the problem in order to fix it.
Thank you very much ya basha, I don't have a specific problem, I just don't like this product in general

I used Umbraco in a very simple project. It did the job. The UI is not beautiful but workin & also it was free.

Last time I checked, when you work with something else other than Sharepoint you won't find a great CMS. Good maybe, but not great. I hope I'm wrong

There are several historical problems with Umbraco that were solved in Umbraco 4. Umbraco 5 considered moving to ASP.NET MVC but then (for good reasons) this didn't happen. They are working on another version now as well combining all the good stuff from Umbraco 4 and even 5. I hope the issue is not one of these old/resolved problems.

This guy used to be one of the core committers of Umbraco official open source repo, even though he doesn't work for the company http://www.aaron-powell.com/tagged/umbraco
I can connect you to him if there is anything specific, as he works at Readify Sydney as well and we worked at the same client for a while.

Thanks again Mohamed, I hope they can make a good version this time and hopfully redesign it or start from scratch. I have been waiting a good free CMS like Sitefinity for years, I decided several times to clone it but I thought it will be a waste of time because definitely the .NET will have a good one 'soon' and 'somebody' is working on it right now, but that didn't happen

> I decided several times to clone it but I thought it will be a waste of time because ....

So all the people who work on open source stuff are "wasting their time"? "Because" is one of the words that I hate.

Do it, even of you're the only one using it. There will be no crappy customer or crappy requirements or crappy manager. Do it or I'll convince you to do it using my 100% effective negotiation skills mentioned in the post I sent earlier today.

LOL إحنا لحمنا مر، أنا متأكد إن أنا أول ما أبدأ فيه، بعدها بشهر و أسبوعين، هلائي : GOOD news for all .NET guys, finally a high-quality free open-source CMS from xx company released today
وبالفعل من فتره، ناس شغالين في ميكروسوفت بدأوا يعملوا واحد اسمه Orchard أو كدا بس آخر مره شوفته فيها كان basic أوي ومش حلو للـ End users اللي هو أصلا أهم شيء أهم من سهولته بالنسبة للـ Developers لأننا مهما كان معكوك أو صعب هنعرف نتصرف إنما المستخدمين الغلابه بيطلع عينهم وبالتالي بيصدعونا

لكن أنا بقالي بتاع 5 سنين بقول كدا، وأدركت إن أنا ماعنديش حاسه سادسه فقلت لما أتفرغ أبدأ باذن الله، حاليا أنا شغال في كذا سايد-بروجيكت، على آخر السنة دي لو مالقتش حاجه نضيفه أوستيك هبدأ في واحد ان شاء الله
So you don't want someone to do something better in a _month_, but you've been saying so for _5 years_????
Continue saying this forever - this is how excuses work - or try to make the next best .net CMS & at least Scott Hanselman may ask you for an episode on Hanselminutes.
أنا ناوي أبدأ والله أول لما أخلص مشروع في إيدي على آخر السنة دي، مش هستنى كالعاده لكن أنا متأكد إن بعدما أبدأ هلائي الدنيا مطرت سي-ام-اس-اااات حلوه بالعند فيّ :D
Moutaz Shams بس اوعى المشروع دا يكون زى مشروع النهضة
لا ياعم، مصر 92 مليون وتاريخ وجغرافيا يعني باذن الله مستقبل الدوت-نت في أمان طول ما هيونداي بتحسن رافعات الزجاج الأمامي
